description: Jean-Luc Martinez, an archaeologist and art historian, will be the next director of the Louvre.
title: New Boss at the Louvre
title_page: New Boss at the Louvre - The New York Times
maintext:
PARIS — Jean-Luc Martinez, the head of the Louvre’s department of Greek, Etruscan and Roman antiquities, was named the museum’s new director on Wednesday.
Mr. Martinez will succeed Henri Loyrette as chairman on April 15, according to a statement from the museum.
Mr. Martinez, 49, was chosen by President François Hollande over two other candidates, Sylvie Ramond, director of the Musée des Beaux Arts in Lyon, and Laurent Le Bon, head of the Centre Pompidou-Metz.
Aurélie Filippetti, the culture minister, welcomed Mr. Martinez’s appointment in a statement, calling him “a great curator who throughout his career has been motivated by a desire to share with the public his passion for art and the fruits of his erudition.”
